io.atomix.catalyst.buffer

Class ReadOnlyBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.atomix.catalyst.buffer.AbstractBuffer
      • io.atomix.catalyst.buffer.ReadOnlyBuffer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Buffer, BufferInput<Buffer>, BufferOutput<Buffer>, BytesInput<Buffer>, BytesOutput<Buffer>, ReferenceCounted<Buffer>, AutoCloseable

    public class ReadOnlyBuffer
extends AbstractBuffer
    Read-only buffer.
    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

      Acquires a reference.
      void close()
      Closes the buffer.

      Compacts the buffer, moving bytes from the current position to the end of the buffer to the head of the buffer.

      Flushes the bytes to the underlying persistence layer.

      • writeBoolean

        public Buffer writeBoolean(long offset,
                           boolean b)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Writes a 1 byte boolean to the buffer at the given offset.

        The boolean will be written as a single byte at the given offset. If there are no bytes remaining in the buffer then a BufferOverflowException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        writeBoolean in interface Buffer
        Specified by:
        writeBoolean in interface BytesOutput<Buffer>
        Overrides:
        writeBoolean in class AbstractBuffer
        Parameters:
        offset - The offset at which to write the boolean.
        b - The boolean to write.
        Returns:
        The written buffer.
        See Also:
        Buffer.writeBoolean(boolean)

      • write

        public Buffer write(Buffer buffer)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Writes a buffer to the buffer.

        When the buffer is written to the buffer, the buffer's position will be advanced by the number of bytes in the provided buffer. If the provided Buffer.remaining() exceeds Buffer.remaining() then an BufferOverflowException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        write in interface Buffer
        Specified by:
        write in interface BufferOutput<Buffer>
        Overrides:
        write in class AbstractBuffer
        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer to write.
        Returns:
        The written buffer.

      • write

        public Buffer write(Bytes bytes)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Writes an array of bytes to the buffer.

        When the bytes are written to the buffer, the buffer's position will be advanced by the number of bytes in the provided byte array. If the number of bytes exceeds Buffer.limit() then an BufferOverflowException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        write in interface Buffer
        Specified by:
        write in interface BufferOutput<Buffer>
        Overrides:
        write in class AbstractBuffer
        Parameters:
        bytes - The array of bytes to write.
        Returns:
        The written buffer.
        See Also:
        Buffer.write(Bytes, long, long), Buffer.write(long, Bytes, long, long)

      • write

        public Buffer write(Bytes bytes,
                    long offset,
                    long length)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Writes an array of bytes to the buffer.

        The bytes will be written starting at the current position up to the given length. If the length of the byte array is larger than the provided length then only length bytes will be read from the array. If the provided length is greater than the remaining bytes in this buffer then a BufferOverflowException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        write in interface Buffer
        Specified by:
        write in interface BufferOutput<Buffer>
        Overrides:
        write in class AbstractBuffer
        Parameters:
        bytes - The array of bytes to write.
        offset - The offset at which to start writing the bytes.
        length - The number of bytes from the provided byte array to write to the buffer.
        Returns:
        The written buffer.
        See Also:
        Buffer.write(Bytes), Buffer.write(long, Bytes, long, long)

      • write

        public Buffer write(long offset,
                    Bytes bytes,
                    long srcOffset,
                    long length)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Writes an array of bytes to the buffer.

        The bytes will be written starting at the given offset up to the given length. If the remaining bytes in the byte array is larger than the provided length then only length bytes will be read from the array. If the provided length is greater than Buffer.limit() minus offset then a BufferOverflowException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        write in interface Buffer
        Specified by:
        write in interface BytesOutput<Buffer>
        Overrides:
        write in class AbstractBuffer
        Parameters:
        offset - The offset at which to start writing the bytes.
        bytes - The array of bytes to write.
        srcOffset - The offset at which to begin reading bytes from the source.
        length - The number of bytes from the provided byte array to write to the buffer.
        Returns:
        The written buffer.
        See Also:
        Buffer.write(Bytes), Buffer.write(Bytes, long, long)

      • write

        public Buffer write(byte[] bytes)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Writes an array of bytes to the buffer.

        When the bytes are written to the buffer, the buffer's position will be advanced by the number of bytes in the provided byte array. If the number of bytes exceeds Buffer.limit() then an BufferOverflowException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        write in interface Buffer
        Specified by:

      • writeByte

        public Buffer writeByte(int b)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Writes a byte to the buffer at the current position.

        When the byte is written to the buffer, the buffer's position will be advanced by Bytes.BYTE. If there are no bytes remaining in the buffer then a BufferOverflowException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        writeByte in interface Buffer
        Specified by:

        Overrides:

      • writeChar

        public Buffer writeChar(char c)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Writes a 16-bit character to the buffer at the current position.

        When the character is written to the buffer, the buffer's position will be advanced by Bytes.CHARACTER. If less than 2 bytes are remaining in the buffer then a BufferOverflowException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        writeChar in interface Buffer
        Specified by:
        writeChar in interface BufferOutput<Buffer>
        Overrides:
        writeChar in class AbstractBuffer

        public Buffer writeLong(long l)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Writes a 64-bit signed integer to the buffer at the current position.

        When the long is written to the buffer, the buffer's position will be advanced by Bytes.LONG. If less than Bytes.LONG bytes are remaining in the buffer then a BufferOverflowException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        writeLong in interface Buffer
        Specified by:
        writeLong in interface BufferOutput<Buffer>
        Overrides:
        writeLong in class AbstractBuffer
        Parameters:
        l - The long to write.
        Returns:
        The written buffer.
        See Also:
        Buffer.writeLong(long, long)

      • writeLong

        public Buffer writeLong(long offset,
                        long l)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Writes a 64-bit signed integer to the buffer at the given offset.

        The long will be written at the given offset. If there are less than Bytes.LONG bytes remaining in the buffer then a BufferOverflowException will be thrown.

      • writeBoolean

        public Buffer writeBoolean(boolean b)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Writes a 1 byte boolean to the buffer at the current position.

        When the boolean is written to the buffer, the buffer's position will be advanced by 1. If there are no bytes remaining in the buffer then a BufferOverflowException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        writeBoolean in interface Buffer
        Specified by:
        writeBoolean in interface BufferOutput<Buffer>
        Overrides:
        writeBoolean in class AbstractBuffer
        Parameters:
        b - The boolean to write.
        Returns:
        The written buffer.
        See Also:
        Buffer.writeBoolean(long, boolean)

      • writeUTF8

        public Buffer writeUTF8(String s)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Writes a UTF-8 string to the buffer at the current position.

        The string will be written with a two-byte unsigned byte length followed by the UTF-8 bytes. If there are not enough bytes remaining in the buffer then a BufferOverflowException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        writeUTF8 in interface Buffer
        Specified by:
        writeUTF8 in interface BufferOutput<Buffer>
        Overrides:
        writeUTF8 in class AbstractBuffer
        Parameters:
        s - The string to write.
        Returns:
        The written buffer.
        See Also:
        Buffer.writeUTF8(long, String)

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Closes the buffer.

        This method effectively acts as an alias to ReferenceCounted.release() and allows buffers to be used as resources in try-with-resources statements. When the buffer is closed the internal reference counter defined by ReferenceCounted will be decremented. However, if references to the buffer still exist then those references will be allowed to continue to operate on the buffer until all references have been released.

        Specified by:
        close in interface Buffer
        Specified by:
        close in interface BufferInput<Buffer>
        Specified by:
        close in interface BufferOutput<Buffer>
        Specified by:
        close in interface ReferenceCounted<Buffer>
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Overrides:
        close in class AbstractBuffer
